comment: Easy A, he knows its a mandatory course and doesnt try to make it hard. I was terrified of learning to code in R but he provided all of the code verbatim for us. I learned a lot! You will get an A if you attend and turn in work. He is easily accessible outside class. Go to office hours if youre ever confused and he will ensure you get it right.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Accessible outside class

comment: Dr. Brown is awesome. He really cares about his students and their success. Attendance is mandatory, but if you email him he will record the lecture for you. I 100% recommend Dr. Brown.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Caring--Accessible outside class

comment: Great professor! Extremely kind! Take him!
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Inspirational--Respected

comment: Dr brown is awesome!! He is super funny and nice as well as empathetic. Showing up to class is the minimum you can do (saw someone talking about attendance) he explains everything very clearly and is willing to help!! Kindest Professor!! Take him!! 100% recommend
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Gives good feedback--Hilarious

comment: Focus on the newer reviews. he really does care about making this class FOR the students! His class is a little complicated but provides work days & will give you the answer if you ask! Dives into the practicality of the course for the real world. He is great w office hours and responding to emails. Def take this prof if you want a smooth class.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Caring--Accessible outside class

comment: Absolutely great professor with his work. He always stay ready to help student at any time. He is really friendly and give chances to recover any lower grade. If you read his notes you can fine all the code to solve problem. Really good professor.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Gives good feedback--Caring

comment: Absolutely loved him! He is very smart and a bit awkward at times, but in a cute way. Really knows his stuff and wants you to succeed. He always provided the code that he used in class and he makes the material relevant. I had him when he first started teaching (when his reviews were bad) and he has REALLY changed for the better. Take his class!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Amazing lectures

comment: I took him for R last fall and had him for regression this spring. He is AMAZING! He has bad reviews for his grad courses from a while back, but you can tell he made a huge effort to fix his mistakes now. Very easy class but you still learn a LOT. I love that he used R in the class as it is very relevant in the real world. TAKE HIM!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Caring

comment: Really awesome dude! The bad reviews are from his grad students (he's hard in his grad classes), but for undergrad classes he's absolutely fine. He's super young and good with technology, so we didn't really miss a beat when we had to switch online due to the COVID-19 pandemic. Very good with communication and just a good-natured dude. Take him!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria

comment: Dr. Brown was a great professor, he was my first A since I have been in college. He made the transition into the online style of class very smooth. This class had a lot of information to remember but if you come to class and pay attention you will be completely fine.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: STRANGE semester. Started out HARD with hard homeworks/quizzes/exams. At the middle of the semester he sent an email apologizing for how hard he's been and that he was going to make it easier. However, the quizzes and tests were HARDER after that email. And then he sent another apology email. Nice dude but bipolar in terms of assignment difficulty.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: I really don't get this guy. His personality is so kind and this is literally just a programming course, but he's made it into one of the most difficult classes I've had. The exams are HARD, the quizzes are now take home but like 15+ questions, and the homework takes days. He's a new guy so that could explain it. Until/unless he changes, avoid.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--So many papers

comment: Extremely nice guy, but as a professor, man. Long assignments due every week and a quiz every class period. I almost feel bad putting this review he's such a good natured dude. Please though, don't let that fool you. He's unnecessarily difficult with his quizzes & assignments. Take someone else if you can. I wish I did.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: Currently in a grad school course with him. He goes way too hard in a class that should be simple! It's a basic programming course and it's challenging quizzes EVERY week, homework EVERY week, multiple exams and a project. He's a really nice person but as a professor, he needs to let up. WAY too much much work and stress on us.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Lecture heavy--So many papers

comment: He was an excellent teacher. He explained and showed things very well in class, and if you needed help, he will always answer your questions the best he can, inside and outside of class. The homework is a lot of work given the extensiveness of the kind of math it is, but as long as you do your homework on time, the tests are usually pretty easy.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Dr. Brown is an amazing professor! We had in-class reviews before every exam, and extra-credit opportunities to make up points after each exam. He let us use a full piece of paper (front and back) as a cheat sheet for each test, and he also let us use any notes we wanted on our final. He graded our exams with feedback, and helpful in office hours
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Austin was always willing to help us out during and after class. He answered my emails within 30 minutes and had the best interest for the students. I would definitely take him again in a heartbeat!

Textbook don't matter do everything he says but I wouldn't contact him as he doesn't really reply back. I took intro stats didn't learn a thing was supposed to be an easy A but he decided to screw most of us over. Dr. brown if you read this thanks for tanking my gpa and ruining my future.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: He is new but also class was very boring and he was awkward. Even going to his office hours to ask questions. Class is easy but he does get mad is you do not show. I wouldn't take him again as i didn't learn anything at all even after trying to get with him for help.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Participation matters--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: This guy is still pretty new. If you take the class make sure to show up in order to pass for the tests he does give extra credit opportunity but still kinda seems like he does not care in a way. He is very awkward class will be boring beware!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: Austin is the definition of a caring, nice, enthusiastic professor. He always was willing to help us no matter the time of day or the reason. Our entire class universally respected and liked him so much. The exams he will prepare you well for and the workload is fair and manageable. Work hard on the mini-projects! I would 10/10 recommend!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Caring

comment: Great guy! Really young & relatable, and really knows his stuff. Made stats super simple for me. Would recommend for any class!
